column4: when it starts booting is there any text output to the screen at all?
: no
what version of ubuntu do you have?
ok, 2 seconds please
sorry, had to check the food i'm making :) anyway, when you insert the cd and you choose "safe graphics mode" what is the very next thing that happens?
: nothing
blank screen eh?
: screen blank
is it a laptop? if so what brand and model is it?
: desktop PC - E6600, P5N-E SLI, 8800GTS 640MB

did you run the disk checker available from the cd menu? it could be that the cd is corrupt. If you run the check and it says everything is fine then you might need to download the "alternative" installer, it runs in text mode and will get the system up and running. a lot of people have the same graphics card so it shouldn't be a problem once you have it installed, the cd can be funny like that sometimes
if the disk checker says there is a problem then you should download a new ubuntu image and burn it again
: I cant even check my disk
/query me if you are still stuck after trying these things
ok, when you insert the cd nothing at all happens?
there is a "check disk for defects" option on that options screen
: I know, I checked it. Nothing showed
nothing showed? you mean it ran but there was no error or what?
: I don't know. Screen goes blank
ok, then it didn't work. i suggest you download the alternate installer and try with that, it's generaly much more reliable in these situations
